In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here is the code in Julia:

```julia
function wrap_string(s, text_width = 10)
    words = split(s, " ")
    result = ""
    line = ""
    for word in words
        if length(line * " $word") > text_width
            result *= "$line\n"
            line = ""
        end
        line *= " $word"
    end
    return result * line
end
```

Here is an example of how to use this function:

```julia
s = "Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Sed do eiusmod tempor incididunt ut labore et dolore magna aliqua."
println(wrap_string(s))
```
This will output:

```julia
Lorem ipsum dolor sit 
amet, consectetur adipiscing 
elit. Sed do eiusmod tempor 
incididunt ut labore et 
dolore magna aliqua.
```
